messages: e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:32): I've just installed NetBSD on a second drive, and I'm trying to configure grub to load it, but I'm.... very confused
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:33): could someone tell me exactly what is supposed to be in the kernel line? I've looked all over the web and the examples I've found don't make sense to me
7bc4fc082fcbb303343765a065237b9b (04:34): yipe: grub is a bitch just like GNU and BSD
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:35): disregarding peoples religious convictions, let's just make this work
6926705165f9c109b3dce48ea3c7b45c (04:35): yipe: Sorry, I have very little experience with grub and netbsd, so I am unable to help you there :(
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:36): that's okay, this is after all #netbsd, someone will come around, I'm patient
6926705165f9c109b3dce48ea3c7b45c (04:36): yipe: I'm sure someone will :) Good luck :)
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:37): while we're waiting.... ems, if you like neither gnu nor bsd.... why are you hanging out in the netbsd chan?
6926705165f9c109b3dce48ea3c7b45c (04:38): yipe: Perhaps he likes all the nice people here? :-)
7bc4fc082fcbb303343765a065237b9b (04:40): yipe: netbsd makes a nice inferno hoster
7bc4fc082fcbb303343765a065237b9b (04:40): so does linux on things netbsd doesn't work out for
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:40): inferno.... isn't that that plan 9 based thing?
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:43): okay.... I'm gonna try a few things, if it works, I'll probably be back soon for help with something else, if it doesn't, I'll be back right away:P
ee774af43741e1dcc007c79c40338cb6 (04:43): ems: what are you doing in here if you're only trying to get people to use inferno?
7bc4fc082fcbb303343765a065237b9b (04:44): virtus: I only tried getting people when I got you ;)
7bc4fc082fcbb303343765a065237b9b (04:46): netbsd can run drawterm so it works for me
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:47): what is the name and location of the netbsd kernel, or loader, or whatever
e779defee7904698907f14d5ba9b70a2 (04:47): FBSD uses /boot/loader , so I gave that a shot
7bc4fc082fcbb303343765a065237b9b (04:47): brb can't irc under these conditions
